About me

I like architecturing a layout to build both in physical world and in coding.

Skills and interests

  • Architecture: University degree in 2007, UPC. I have been involved in different design as well as construction phases in a wide range of projects: from small appartments, retail projects, offices' implementation and currently logitic centers.
  • Coding: Javascript and Typescript. Leraning Python. This lead me to an intensive bootcamp at Skylab as well as to a web development master at UOC, which I will complete this year.
  • Languages: I am a native Spanish and Catalan speaker, fluent in English (C2) and German (C2) , intermediate in French (B2) . My curiosity for foreign languages led me to an Erasmus program in Berlin in 2005. Since then, I have worked in several Projects abroad (EU).
  • Classical music: not so good piano player.
  • Trekking: some fresh mountain air feels good.

My projects

  • Quiz

    sourcecode website August, 2020

    The project is based on this open trivia api and was developed as a group project at Skylab bootcamp. The Open Trivia Database provides a completely free JSON API for use in programming projects. The data provided by the API is available under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License .

    We had much fun developing this project.

    Collaborators: Victor Alemany

    React Flux scss Firebase Jest

  • Tender

    sourcecode website September, 2020

    This was my final project in Skylab bootcamp. App prototype to help agents working in tendering processes.

    Mission: 'easier tendering process for organizers and providers'.

    Main goals: monitor process workflow, share public data across agents, keep private data hidden, facilitate agreements, bids submittal and review.

    React sass Redux OAuth Node Express Joi MongoDB D3 Material UI Jest Mocha Sinon Chai NYC - coverage

  • Recipes

    sourcecode website June, 2021

    The main goal of this project is to create a small site using a custom boilerplate, and avoiding to use front-end frameworks. A tiny parser has been created to allow a SPA run in vanilla JS. It is, at least still, not yet another complete JS framework and the aim is not to fill internet with endless packages but to learn coding - mainly for fun.

    Navigo Babel Parcel sass PostCSS Autoprefixer Netlify Firebase Lighthouse Jest

  • Game of Life

    sourcecode website September, 2020

    A vanilla Javascript version of Game Of Life by the British mathematician Horton Conway. Canvas was used to create a board for the game as well as the animations.

    This project was developed at an early stage of Skylab bootcamp.

    Canvas Jasmine Javascript

Conway's game of life
